description: Initial study setup tasks including protocol details and sponsor information.
Assign study team roles and responsibilities.
Set up site and investigator profile data.
Configure workflow and enrollment settings.
Feasibility questionnaire, responses, calls, and assessment.
SQV scheduling, visits, facility and staffing assessment.
Final approval, site addition to CTMS, and site notification.
Activities related to preparing and submitting IRB/IEC regulatory packets.
Tracking IRB queries, responses, fees, and submissions.
ICF and questionnaire translations and approvals.
Final IRB/IEC/MoH approvals and tracking approval dates.
Post-approval document uploads and protocol alignment checks.
Upload draft and final contracts, send to site, resolve redlines
Upload budget proposals, review internally, negotiate and approve
Collect banking info, validate tax docs, configure payments
Upload PI CV, license, GCP, disclosure, signature
Upload Sub-I CV, license, and GCP certificates
Upload study coordinator CV and training records
Upload 1572, IRB roster, SOPs, lab certifications, DOA
Verify document completeness and approve essential document packet
Generate DOA log template and map staff responsibilities
Upload signed DOA log, verify signatures, approve completion
Upload training plan, conduct study training session
Upload and verify GCP certificates for all staff
Provide EDC, CTMS, IWRS/IRT training and upload completion logs
Plan and prepare site recruitment and pre-screening activities
Ensure screening tools and staff are trained and ready
Schedule and track subjects for screening and enrollment
Prepare pharmacy and investigational product (IP) storage, documentation, and assessments
Conduct IP handling training and upload training certificates
Track IP shipment, receipt, and accountability logs
Approve overall Pharmacy/IP readiness
Verify lab certifications, sample handling SOPs, portal access, and other lab readiness items
Confirm lab kits received, validate temperature-controlled storage, and courier setup
Collect tax documents, verify banking info, configure payments, and approve vendor setup
Upload legal/compliance documents and validate site administration requirements
Approve overall financial and administrative setup
Schedule SIV, share agenda & training materials, and conduct pre-SIV checks
Conduct SIV onsite or remote, upload SIV report, and capture attendance
Resolve action items and approve SIV completion
Ensure all regulatory, contract, documents, training, pharmacy/IP, lab, and system setups are complete
Issue site activation letter and mark site as active in CTMS
